properties.name: A wonderful North Woods Beach
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth  about a half mile strech of sand between sandstone cliffs on this pristine Lake Superior shore. Words can\'t do it justice, you\'ll just have to go see for yourself. We got baked by the sunshine one day, rained out the next morning.

properties.name: Allen's Creek
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothI\'ve camped here way too many times. The place used to have a nice magical quality to it, but has gotten trashed as years went on. Great place for geodes and other fossilized action, however.

properties.name: Big Horn Mountains
properties.description: Posted by Invisigothten sleep, WYNice Mountain range with beautiful scenery, a large collection of mountain lakes, trout fishing and great campsites. Out of the way, so it\'s not so crowded as Tetons would be, but, no volcanic activity...

properties.name: Bungalow
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothA very cozy lounge with great staff, music and drinks

properties.name: Bungalow Loungebar
properties.description: Posted by Samauck1622 W. Belmont Ave. Chicago, ILOne of the finest spots in Lakeview. Great drinks, decor and a friendly staff. Highly recommended!

properties.name: Death Valley
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothAs luck would have it, we were there on one of only two days it rains there the whole year. Still, what a great park. Salt flats, mountains, Joshua Tree forests, sand dunes... We actually ended up setting up camp just outside the park near an air force base, and witnessed "dogfights" style of training. Top Gun, baby!

properties.name: Delicate Arch
properties.description: Posted by Invisigotha very crowded tourist attraction, neat, desert-like hike among way too many R.V.ers. This Park has no backcountry.

properties.name: Jason 13
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothA nice backcountry campsite on the quiet side of Lake Monroe, mainly used by Largemouth Bass fishermen and accessed mainly by boat, we bushwacked off the trail to it a few times. Good fishing.

properties.name: Medicine Bow Peak
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth Lots of High plateaus and alpine vegetation. Snow caps remain above timberline all year round. I had succumbed to elevation sickness and was, largely, miserable to fully enjoy it. Parade of livestock on the 4th of July in Laramie was priceless. They just ran the cattle down the street...

properties.name: Morro Bay Beach
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth  Central Coast. Sea Elephants, surfers, R.V.ers on PCH. They let us burn a campfire on the beach and even sold us a bundle of firewood. Waking up on the pacific is awesome.

properties.name: North Manitou Sunset Beach
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth  a very tranquil place, the island has no roads or electricity, the beach: not too many footsteps on it. A ferry connects to the mainland once a day around noon.

properties.name: Old School Forest Preserve
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth  A neat forested trail with excersise stations and a decent fishing lake. Flat, small, too close to the highway so that the traffic noise is ever-present

properties.name: Red River Gorge
properties.description: Posted by Invisigothred river gorge, KYI was there on a 4th of July in \'99. Hot, horseflies and drunken rednecks everywhere, but the scenery is mighty nice, almost rainforest/jungle like with red sand and waterfalls...

properties.name: Salud
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothA mexican inspired bar and a nice kitchen, average sound system, yuppified crowd. 2 am license.

properties.name: Sleeping Bear Dunes
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothWe were stuck in "tent city" the entire time at this backcountry site, but got to link two tents into an apartment with a vestibule for boots and cookery. Neat-o.

properties.name: Smokies
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothIn december, this is one spooky place. The "fog" or "smoke" hangs dense, the park is largely deserted and quiet, water permeates everything. Eerily beautiful.

properties.name: Streetside Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tomiiko 3201 W Armitage Ave Chicago, IL 60647Dennis\' fav place to spin.

properties.name: Streetside Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth 3201 W. Armitage, chicagoA nice cozy bar and and grill

properties.name: The Cave
properties.description: Posted by Invisigotha nice campsite, nestled atop a limestone formation with a decent sized cave directly beneath the site. Lure fishing is dicey, give the amount of debris underwater.

properties.name: The Silver Room
properties.description: Posted by InvisigothA boutique for all things silver, hats and magazines. The booth is in the back. DJs play on saturdays.

properties.name: Watehouse
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth3407 N. Paulina, Chicago, 60657A nice 2 o\'clock bar and kitchen, decent food. Young, inexperienced waitstaff. I play there on Wednesdays.

properties.name: fixture
properties.description: Posted by Invisigoth3201 W. Armitage, chicagoA loungy chef-inspired small plate spot where I play on wednesdays
